channel.title: Muslim Hackers?
channel.description:
Somebody uploaded this html file to my site yesterday, three times: [IMG]http://i37.tinypic.com/1zei16q.png[/img]
My website doesn't appear to be hacked though.. Should I be worried?

item.title: Muslim Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:26, topic:309522”][quote author=Newty link=topic=405973.msg3001580#msg3001580 date=1256044381]
“Hacked by TreX”

Capital T, Capital X = T X

He used to be well known on runesever

[/quote]

wooooooooooooooooooooooooooooow go away[/quote]

stfu, we know you <3 me

item.title: Muslim Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

T_x is probably still around, attacking RSC servers, evading bans and whatnot.
Dynamic IP addresses are the bane of the internet for any website with an interest in enforcing a ban beyond the scope of an account, without making the site invite-only.
It’s a PITA.

Read full topic

item.title: Muslim Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:21, topic:309522”][quote author=Newty link=topic=405973.msg3001693#msg3001693 date=1256056331]

“Hacked by TreX”

Capital T, Capital X = T X

He used to be well known on runesever

so what you are saying is that this T X guy from rüneserver have hacked over 5000 sites?

http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&safe=off&rlz=1C1GGLS_noNO340NO340&q="Hacked+by+TreX"&start=0&sa=N

Ask super_

I guarentee it’s him.
[/quote]I hurd T_x was put out of business?[/quote]

Doesn’t seem like it.

Read full topic

item.title: Muslim Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

it’s prolly just a shitty exploit, nothing to worry about (unless they upload sth like a c99 shell :mad:)

So you reckon their only hacking is managing to upload a html file when they’re not supposed to? The files aren’t stored as flat files, and the contents are checked before allowing someone to download the file. Code is never executed because the file contents are output as-is with a file download header.

Read full topic

item.title: Muslim Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:

it’s prolly just a shitty exploit, nothing to worry about (unless they upload sth like a c99 shell :mad:)

item.title: Muslim Hackers?
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Yes I obviously allow people to upload files, but I think they may have done something in another area of my site because file uploading is set up pretty securely.

I know nobody can tell me if they’ve actually done anything, I’m just wondering how often weird shit like this happens. I’ve never had anything to do with underground hacking groups so don’t know how they work, so this could just be some retard trying to scare me, a skiddie who somehow uploaded one of those php c99 scripts or someone could actually have root access to my server.

Read full topic
